doc.after: The Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth was created in 1569 As a member of the Commonwealth Lithuania retained its institutions including a separate army currency and statutory laws 16 Eventually Polonization affected all aspects of Lithuanian life politics language culture and national identity From the mid 16th to the mid 17th centuries culture arts and education flourished fueled by the Renaissance and the Protestant Reformation From 1573 the Kings of Poland and Grand Dukes of Lithuania were elected by the nobility who were granted ever increasing Golden Liberties These liberties especially the liberum veto led to anarchy and the eventual dissolution of the state
